par.text: Platinum is a silvery-white, fairly soft, dense metal. It is malleable and ductile. It is considered a precious metal; other precious metals are: gold, silver, iridium and palladium. It is resistant to atmospheric exposure and oxidation. Unaffected by most acids, it dissolves slowly only in aqua regia (a mixture of 3 parts of hydrochloric acid and 1 part of nitric acid by volume). Platinum has the ability to absorb gases, like oxygen or hydrogen.
